intro: Roscoea alpina var. minor, commonly known as the Alpine Roscoea, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow to orange-red flowers during the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
